Package org.opensextant.geodesy

Class Geodetic2DArc

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.geodesy.Geodetic2DArc
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Geodetic2DArc>
public class Geodetic2DArc extends Object implements Serializable, Comparable<Geodetic2DArc>
The Geodetic2DArc class represents two geodetic points on the surface of an Ellipsoid, the distance in meters on the surface between them, and the forward azimuth (Angle from North to use as heading from point 1 to point 2). It includes a constructor that takes the two points and then calculates the distance and azimuth, as well as a constructor that takes the first point, distance, and azimuth and computes the second point. There are variations that assume the WGS-84 Ellipsoid and ones that allow the user to specify which Ellipsoid to use. This code was adapted from the open source GeoTools project, having been translated to Java from original Fortran published by NOAA.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Geodetic2DArc()
    The default constructor creates a degenerate Geodetic2DArc with both points at (0,0).
    Geodetic2DArc(Ellipsoid ellip, Geodetic2DPoint point1, double distanceInMeters, Angle forwardAzimuth)
    This constructor takes the Ellipsoid model of the earth, the first geodetic point, an Angle of forward azimuth, and a distance in meters, and then computes the second geodetic point that lies at that distance along that azimuth.
    Geodetic2DArc(Ellipsoid ellip, Geodetic2DPoint point1, Geodetic2DPoint point2)
    This constructor takes the Ellipsoid and two geodetic points, and computes the forward azimuth and distance in meters between them.
    Geodetic2DArc(Geodetic2DPoint point1, double distanceInMeters, Angle forwardAzimuth)
    This constructor assumes the WGS-84 Ellipsoid model of the earth, takes the first geodetic point, an Angle of forward azimuth, and a distance in meters, and then computes the second geodetic point that lies at that distance along that azimuth.
    Geodetic2DArc(Geodetic2DPoint point1, Geodetic2DPoint point2)
    This constructor assumes the WGS-84 Ellipsoid model of the earth, takes two geodetic points, and computes the forward azimuth and distance in meters between them.

  • Constructor Details

    • Geodetic2DArc

      public Geodetic2DArc()
      The default constructor creates a degenerate Geodetic2DArc with both points at (0,0).

    • Geodetic2DArc

      public Geodetic2DArc(Geodetic2DPoint point1, Geodetic2DPoint point2)
      This constructor assumes the WGS-84 Ellipsoid model of the earth, takes two geodetic points, and computes the forward azimuth and distance in meters between them.
      Parameters:
      point1 - first Geodetic2DPoint (fixed)
      point2 - second Geodetic2DPoint (re-settable)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if point1 or point2 are null

    • Geodetic2DArc

      public Geodetic2DArc(Ellipsoid ellip, Geodetic2DPoint point1, Geodetic2DPoint point2)
      This constructor takes the Ellipsoid and two geodetic points, and computes the forward azimuth and distance in meters between them.
      Parameters:
      ellip - Ellipsoid model of the earth to use
      point1 - first Geodetic2DPoint (fixed)
      point2 - second Geodetic2DPoint (re-settable)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if ellip, point1 or point2 are null

    • Geodetic2DArc

      public Geodetic2DArc(Geodetic2DPoint point1, double distanceInMeters, Angle forwardAzimuth)
      This constructor assumes the WGS-84 Ellipsoid model of the earth, takes the first geodetic point, an Angle of forward azimuth, and a distance in meters, and then computes the second geodetic point that lies at that distance along that azimuth.
      Parameters:
      point1 - first Geodetic2DPoint (fixed)
      forwardAzimuth - Angle from North of azimuth from point 1 to point 2
      distanceInMeters - double distance in meters on surface of Ellipsoid
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if error in argument values is detected

    • Geodetic2DArc

      public Geodetic2DArc(Ellipsoid ellip, Geodetic2DPoint point1, double distanceInMeters, Angle forwardAzimuth)
      This constructor takes the Ellipsoid model of the earth, the first geodetic point, an Angle of forward azimuth, and a distance in meters, and then computes the second geodetic point that lies at that distance along that azimuth.
      Parameters:
      ellip - Ellipsoid model of the earth to use
      point1 - first Geodetic2DPoint (fixed)
      distanceInMeters - double distance in meters on surface of Ellipsoid
      forwardAzimuth - Angle from North of azimuth from point 1 to point 2
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if error in argument values is detected
      NullPointerException - if ellip, point1 or forwardAzimuth are null

      Returns:
      Geodetic2DPoint point 1 (re-settable)

    • setPoint2

      public void setPoint2(Geodetic2DPoint point2)
      This method is used to re-set the second geodetic point of this Geodetic2DArc object, resulting in the recalculation of forward azimuth and distance.
      Parameters:
      point2 - second Geodetic2DPoint (re-settable)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if point2 is null

    • getForwardAzimuth

      @NotNull public @NotNull Angle getForwardAzimuth()
      This method returns the Angle of forward azimuth from point 1 and point 2.
      Returns:
      Angle from North of forward azimuth (shortest distance direction from point1)

    • setForwardAzimuth

      public void setForwardAzimuth(Angle forwardAzimuth)
      This method is used to set the Angle of forward azimuth from point 1, resulting in point 2 to be recalculated at the current distance in meters.
      Parameters:
      forwardAzimuth - Angle from North of forward azimuth
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if forwardAzimuth is null

    • getDistanceInMeters

      public double getDistanceInMeters()
      This method returns the shortest distance in meters between the geodetic points 1 and 2 of this Geodetic2DArc object.
      Returns:
      double shortest distance in meters on Ellipsoid between points 1 and 2

    • setDistanceInMeters

      public void setDistanceInMeters(double distanceInMeters)
      This method is used to set a new distance in meters for this Geodetic2DArc object, resulting in the calculation of a new second point.
      Parameters:
      distanceInMeters - double distance from point 1 to new point 2
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if distance is out of legal range

    • setDistanceAndAzimuth

      public void setDistanceAndAzimuth(double distanceInMeters, Angle forwardAzimuth) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to simultaneously set a new distance in meters and forward azimuth for this Geodetic2DArc object, resulting in the calculation of a new second point.
      Parameters:
      distanceInMeters - double distance from point 1 to new point 2
      forwardAzimuth - Angle from North of forward azimuth
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if distance is out of legal range
      NullPointerException - if forwardAzimuth is null
